channel.title: Apple Treats
channel.description:
Bite-sized news for Apple developers.
Podcast hosts: Danis Tazetdinov: twitter: https://twitter.com/edeniska, telegram: https://t.me/edeniska Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.
Podcast has its own channel: https://t.me/AppleTreatsNews
channel.content:encoded:
Bite-sized news for Apple developers.

Podcast hosts:
Danis Tazetdinov: Twitter @edeniska, Telegram @edeniska (Apple Developer News channel).

Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.

Podcast has its own Telegram channel @AppleTreatsNews.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bite-sized news for Apple developers.
channel.itunes:author: Apple Treats

item.title: Feb 9, 2021 – pilot
item.itunes:author: Apple Treats
item.itunes:subtitle: This our pilot episode where we're getting familiar with podcasting and discussing beginning of 2021.
item.content:encoded:
On today's show:
- new releases and new betas of Apple OSes;
- M1 Macs get more and more attention from developers;
- SwiftUI is taking its steps outside Apple ecosystem;
- Apple invites developers for special events. Well, at least some of the developers.

Watch this episode on YouTube.

Podcast hosts:
Danis Tazetdinov: Twitter @edeniska, Telegram @edeniska (Apple Developer News channel).

Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.

Subscribe to our Telegram @AppleTreatsNews and Twitter @AppleTreatsNews.

item.title: Feb 23, 2021 – Privacy, tracking and developers
item.itunes:author: Apple Treats
item.itunes:subtitle: We cover privacy, tracking and how iOS 14.5 will affect developers.
item.content:encoded:
Also on today's show:
- Apple's efforts to make iOS more secure;
- how to deal with analytics in modern era;
- how authorities and industry reacts to Apple's moves in data privacy;
- what's new in beta and release updates;
- how apps and developers affect our lives.

Watch this episode on YouTube.

Podcast hosts:
Danis Tazetdinov: Twitter @edeniska, Telegram @edeniska (Apple Developer News channel).

Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.

Subscribe to our Telegram @AppleTreatsNews and Twitter @AppleTreatsNews.

item.title: Mar 8, 2021 – International Women's Day
item.itunes:author: Apple Treats
item.description:
Special episode of Apple Treats devoted to International Women's Day. We cover stories of girls getting into iOS development and discuss what it takes to make apps for women, and look into smartphone addiction from developers' perspective.
Our guests: - Sitora Guliamova, iOS engineer at EPAM Systems, cat-lover, Instagram: https://instagram.com/sitic_16 - Svetlana Shardakova, iOS engineer at EPAM Systems, Instagram: https://instagram.com/sunny_junne
item.itunes:subtitle: Special episode of Apple Treats devoted to International Women's Day.
item.content:encoded:
We cover stories of girls getting into iOS development and discuss what it takes to make apps for women, and look into smartphone addiction from developers' perspective.

Our guests:
- Sitora Guliamova, iOS engineer at EPAM Systems, cat-lover, Instagram: @sitic_16.
- Svetlana Shardakova, iOS engineer at EPAM Systems, Instagram: @sunny_junne.

Watch this episode on YouTube.

Podcast hosts:
Danis Tazetdinov: Twitter @edeniska, Telegram @edeniska (Apple Developer News channel).

Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.

Subscribe to our Telegram @AppleTreatsNews and Twitter @AppleTreatsNews.

item.title: Mar 23, 2021 – Teamwork on mobile projects
item.itunes:author: Apple Treats
item.description:
On this episode we're discussing specifics of working on mobile projects in big (or small) teams.
Our guest: - Nikita Leonov, principal developer at Atlassian, https://twitter.com/leonovco
item.itunes:subtitle: On this episode we're discussing specifics of working on mobile projects in big (or small) teams.
item.content:encoded:
How to work on mobile projects? What does it take to scale the team? How Atlassian works on its projects? Did last year change much in development? All of these questions are addressed in this episode.

Our guest:
- Nikita Leonov, principal developer at Atlassian, Twitter: @leonovco.

Watch this episode on YouTube.

Podcast hosts:
Danis Tazetdinov: Twitter @edeniska, Telegram @edeniska (Apple Developer News channel).

Iryna Yatskevich: engineer enjoying adopting new tech, currently slightly changed her stack to work on brand new baby-startup Monika.

Subscribe to our Telegram @AppleTreatsNews and Twitter @AppleTreatsNews.

item.title: Apr 6, 2021 – Security for developers
item.itunes:author: Apple Treats
item.description:
In our fifth episode we talk on Application Security and, of course, about privacy. What are our expectations of WWDC21? What iOS 14.5 brings to users and developers? Apple rejects apps using privacy-unfriendly SDKs, China apps use their own fingerprinting approachs. Of course, we couldn't avoid discussing Facebook and leak of 526M accounts. We also talk on new threats for developers and basic things to start with, if you're interested in increasing app's security.
Further reading and watching: Apple Platform Security: https://support.apple.com/guide/security/welcome/web OWASP Mobile Security Testing Guide: https://github.com/OWASP/owasp-mstg OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard: https://github.com/OWASP/owasp-masvs
Workbook for "Security data management for app devs": https://github.com/vixentael/security-data-management-for-app-devs-workshop Mobile Notts 2021 talk: End-to-end encrypted doesn't mean secure: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CqsrA4eeGSs
Our guest: - Anastasiia Voitova, Head of Customer Solutions, Security Software engineer at Cossack Labs, https://twitter.com/vixentael
item.itunes:subtitle: In our fifth episode we talk on Application Security and, of course, about privacy.
item.content:encoded:
What are our expectations of WWDC21? What iOS 14.5 brings to users and developers? Apple rejects apps using privacy-unfriendly SDKs, China apps use their own fingerprinting approachs.
Of course, we couldn't avoid discussing Facebook and leak of 526M accounts. We also talk on new threats for developers and basic things to start with, if you're interested in increasing app's security.

Further reading and watching:
Apple Platform Security

OWASP Mobile Security Testing Guide

OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard

Workbook for "Security data management for app devs"

Mobile Notts 2021 talk: End-to-end encrypted doesn't mean secure

Our guest:
- Anastasiia Voitova, Head of Customer Solutions, Security Software engineer at Cossack Labs, @vixentael.

Watch this episode on YouTube.
